kpa.command

Class CompoundCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • kpa.command.Command
      • kpa.command.CompoundCommand

  • public class CompoundCommand
extends Command
    A compound command consists of a sequence of commands. Commands can be added one by one to the compound command. All added commands must have the same execution status as the compound command. The client can select the initial execution status in the constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(Command command)
         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Adds a given command at the end of the sequence, ignoring null commands. A CompoundCommand is just added "as is".
        Parameters:
        command - the command to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if execution state of added command does not match that of this compound command
        Precondition:
        command != null \implies this.isExecuted() == command.isExecuted()

      • addAll

        public void addAll(CompoundCommand compound)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                   java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Adds the commands in a given compound command at the end of the sequence.
        Parameters:
        compound - the compound command to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if compound == null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if execution state of compound does not match that of this compound command
        Precondition:
        compound != null && this.isExecuted() == compound.isExecuted()

        Gets number of commands in this command.

        number of commands in this
